titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I worked more uselessly than ever at the Lecture. After lunch I motored with Lilley to Bishop's Castle, and there met the clergy of the Rural Deanery. There were present beside the Archdeacon & the Rural dean (Rev. C. E. Warner) the following:–

item.hi: " W. E. Glenn, Rector of Mainstone
" J. G. Hughes, Rector of Myndtown
" E. H. G. de Castro Vicar of Sibdon
" W. M. D. La Touche, Rector of Wistanston

p.hi: We discussed the Franchise, and the relation of Anglicans & Nonconformists. On the first, there was unanimity for the Baptismal Franchise. On the last, no clear idea.
We returned to Hereford at a speed of about 28 miles an hour, a good record for my rather deliberate car. There were occasional showers, but nothing serious.
